authors.name: Laura  Smith
authors.affiliation: Department of Clinical and Movement Neurosciences, Queen Square Institute of Neurology, University College London (UCL)

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"egmof","text":"Taurocholate inhibits the cytosolic B–glucosidase (GBA2) and activates lysosomal B–glucosidase (GBA1, a.k.a glucocerebrosidase (GCase)).In cultured cells the pH optimum is increased in the presence of taurocholate.Cultured cells are assayed without taurocholate at pH 4.5 and with taurocholate at pH 5.4.In normal controls and heterozygotes the B-glucosidase activity in the presence of taurocholate is approximately 2-10 times higher than without taurocholate.In cases of Gaucher disease the -glucosidase activity may be lower in the presence of the taurocholate.However, in fibroblasts there can be as much as a threefold increase in activity but the specific activity is very low compared with controls and heterozygotes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lp7j","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c18ur","text":"At acid pH B–glucosidase hydrolyses the substrate 4–methylumbelliferyl–B–D–glucopyranoside to 4–methylumbelliferone and glucose.Adding alkaline buffer stops the enzyme reaction and causes 4–methylumbelliferone to fluoresce at a different wavelength from unhydrolysed substrate, thereby permitting its measurement in the presence of a vast excess of unhydrolysed substrate.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"31ttg","text":"Taurocholate inhibits the cytosolic –glucosidase (GBA2) and activates lysosomal –glucosidase (GBA1, a.k.a glucocerebrosidase (GCase)).In cultured cells the pH optimum is increased in the presence of taurocholate.Cultured cells are assayed without taurocholate at pH 4.5 and with taurocholate at pH 5.4.In normal controls and heterozygotes the -glucosidase activity in the presence of taurocholate is approximately 2-10 times higher than without taurocholate.In cases of Gaucher disease the -glucosidase activity may be lower in the presence of the taurocholate.However, in fibroblasts there can be as much as a threefold increase in activity but the specific activity is very low compared with controls and heterozygotes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4ph1","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cqpp","text":"At acid pH –glucosidase hydrolyses the substrate 4–methylumbelliferyl––D–glucopyranoside to 4–methylumbelliferone and glucose.Adding alkaline buffer stops the enzyme reaction and causes 4–methylumbelliferone to fluoresce at a different wavelength from unhydrolysed substrate, thereby permitting its measurement in the presence of a vast excess of unhydrolysed substrate.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m8cv","text":"Clinical Genetics (1978) 13:145 – 153.D.A. Wenger, C. Clark, M. Sattler and C. Wharton.Synthetic substrate –glucosidase activity in leucocytes:A reproducible method for the identification of patients and carriers of Gaucher’s disease.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33p8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dghn","text":"Buffers: McIlvaine citrate–phosphate (MV), pH 5.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvc13","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmns8","text":"Substrates: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atq9s","text":"- GCase: 4–methylumbelliferyl–β–D–glucopyranoside (MWt. 338)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7su3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"espgr","text":"Standard:4–methylumbelliferone (MWt. 176) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40f68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89gp4","text":"NaT:Na taurocholate 80 mg / ml H2O (149 mM) – make fresh ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":32,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tn30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iagm","text":"Stopping solution:0.25 M glycine buffer pH 10.4 reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i00l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsitn","text":"Inhibitors: CBE (Sigma 5424) and DNJ (Enzo BML-SL230-005).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ojj7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5reun","text":"McIlvaine citrate–phosphate (MV):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jih5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11i84","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv6ma","text":" GCase + NaT GCase HEX and β-gal pH 5.4 pH 4.5 pH 4.1 0.1 M citric acid 44 ml 54 ml 30 ml 0.2 M Na2HPO4 56 ml 46 ml 20 ml, then 1:1            ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":262}],"data":{}},{"key":"96hk3","text":"0.1M citric acid monohydrate (Mwt = 210.14 g/mol) – 5.2535 g in 250 mL dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95sck","text":"0.2M Na2HPO4 (Mwt = 141.9 g/mol) – 7.098 g in 250 mL dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":""},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[127,110,102,115],"data":[[" "," GCase + NaT "," GCase ",""],[" "," pH 5.4 "," pH 4.5 ",""],[" 0.1 M citric acid "," 44 ml "," 54 ml ",""],[" 0.2 M Na2HPO4 "," 56 ml "," 46 ml ",""]],"guid":"72BCBB54C70611ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[[" "," GCase + NaT "," GCase ",""],[" "," pH 5.4 "," pH 4.5 ",""],[" 0.1 M citric acid "," 44 ml "," 54 ml ",""],[" 0.2 M Na2HPO4 "," 56 ml "," 46 ml ",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9930k","text":"GCase: 4–methylumbelliferyl–β–D–glucopyranoside (MWt. 338) (Sigma M3633)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ail0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oru5","text":"Take 250 mg in 74 mL dH2O and heat at 80’C until dissolved (3.38mg/ml) to give 10 mM concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e23n","text":"Aliquot into bijou tubes and store at -20 indefinitely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dgu5","text":"For each experiment, heat at 60-80’C in oven to ensure all powder is solubilised.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26oeu","text":"Standard: 4–methylumbelliferone (MWt. 176) (Sigma M1381):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkle3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ao7","text":"Desired concentration is 1 nmol in 200 uL aliquots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dctmu","text":"Take 2 mg in 1.5 mL dH2O, then do a 1:1000 dilution in dH2O to give a 0.2ug/200ul concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s0fu","text":"Aliquot into 200 uls in eppendorfs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3o98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92v48","text":"When using in experiment, add 1 mL glycine buffer to Eppendorf and load 200 uL into each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ceh2h","text":"Na taurocholate 80 mg / ml H2O (149 mM):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40},{"style":"sub","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20a4d","text":"Make fresh (measure NaT on scale then take x grams / 80 * 1000 to give uL of dH2O to resuspend).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8m8iu","text":"Stopping buffer: 0.25 M glycine buffer pH 10.4 reagent:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t59c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85qms","text":"Make up 64g NaOH in 200 mL dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8c0e","text":"Make up 150g glycine in 1600 mL dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dul0","text":"When all mixed, add both together.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs19a","text":"Ensure pH is 10.4 and make up to 2 L with dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tq8p","text":"Inhibitors:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dg2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"496u3","text":"When these arrive, re-constitute powder as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ul4h","text":"a.CBE (Sigma C5424, Mr=162): 5mg / 617ul dH2O = 50mM","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14f3a","text":"b.DNJ (Enzo BML-SL230-005): 5mg / 195ul dH2O = 100mM","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29lvt","text":"37oC water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gl9k","text":"Plate reader, excitation 360 nm, emission 460 nm, sensitivity=50","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lf2j","text":"Enzyme:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6so34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6omvd","text":"Samples are resuspended in water or 1% (v/v) TX-100 in PBS. For TX-100 lysis, cells incubated on ice for 15 mins and debris/nuclei removed by centrifugation at 17, 000 x g, 10 min, 4 °C. Supernatant containing GBA enzyme placed in fresh tube. All samples are sonicated in water bath for 1 minute. Protein concentration measured with BCA protein assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83glp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8eh1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbut3","text":"Dilute in water a portion of the sonicate to give a protein concentration of 0.25 - 4 mg / ml.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d19gh","text":"Set up mix in eppendorf tubes for each well as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bejt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36cbs","text":"Make a master mix e.g multiply by number of wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ba95f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i4kh","text":"GCase at pH 5.4 + NaT:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amm8m","text":"5 µl MV buffer pH 5.4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ui27","text":"3 µl Na taurocholate solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vuf1","text":"10 µl MUG substrate solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa3s4","text":"+/- 0.4 µL 50mM CBE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjt38","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7h5l","text":"GCase at pH 4.5:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3qhr","text":"5 µl MV buffer pH 5.4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r7js","text":"3 µl dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20mh4","text":"10 µl MUG substrate solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjke4","text":"+/- 0.4 µL 100 mM DNJ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63l09","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aklrm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekrmg","text":"Add 10 µl diluted enzyme sample in to duplicate wells of a 96 well plate. (Note: may have to optimise volume of sample loaded depending on sensitivity of fluorescence machine used).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1cgl","text":"Add 10 µl of lysis buffer used (water of TX-100 in PBS) to duplicate wells to serve as substrate blanks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1etru","text":"Add 18 µl of reaction mixture to each well (18.4 per well if inhibitors used).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bt5q","text":"Incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1j61h","text":"Add 220 µL stopping solution to each well ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hc2m","text":"Standard:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq83c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atn85","text":"To 1 nmol 4–methylumbelliferone standard in 200 µl H2O add ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cuvf","text":"1.0 ml stopping reagent.Mix and 200 ml to empty wells to serve as a fluorescence standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98ju9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"127rh","text":"Read fluorescence, excitation 360 nm, emission 460 nm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"988qa","text":"Calculate activity in nmol / hr / mg protein","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: In Vitro GCase Activity Assay (Total Cell Lysate)
